thread.title: Democrats back up Clinton ahead of Benghazi testimony
thread.title_full: Democrats back up Clinton ahead of Benghazi testimony

author: Stephen Dinan
title: Democrats back up Clinton ahead of Benghazi testimony
text:
Democrats back up Clinton ahead of Benghazi testimony Report clears former secretary of harsh charges regarding 2012 attack FILE - In this Jan. 23, 2013 file photo, then-Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton testifies on Capitol Hill in Washington before the Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing on the deadly September attack on the U.S. diplomatic mission in Benghazi, ... more > By Stephen Dinan - The Washington Times - Monday, October 19, 2015 
Democrats on Monday stepped up their effort to paint the House Benghazi probe as a partisan witch-hunt, releasing a massive new report saying that circumstantial evidence shows the committee has become far more intent on attacking former Secretary of State Hillary Rodham Clinton ’s emails than in getting to the facts about the 2012 terrorist attack. 
The report argues that there’s no evidence Mrs. Clinton ordered a military stand-down the night of the attack, nor that she was responsible for the security situation in Benghazi in the run-up to the attack. And Democrats said the evidence suggests Mrs. Clinton was trying to navigate a tricky intelligence picture in the hours and days after the attack. 
“After seventeen months and millions of taxpayer dollars spent, the Select Committee on Benghazi has uncovered nothing that alters our core understanding of the facts as revealed by the other eight investigations,” said Rep. Adam Schiff, California Democrat and a member of the panel. “When you consider the committee’s obsessive focus on attacking Secretary Clinton , the reason becomes quite clear: the majority has little interest in the events in Benghazi except to the degree they can be used to diminish her standing in the polls.” 
The new Democratic report releases excerpts from some of the more than 50 interviews the committee has done so far, and in each of those snippets the witnesses deny some of the harsh accusations against the State Department and Mrs. Clinton , including that she told the military not to mount a rescue mission. 
“None of the 54 individuals interviewed by the Select Committee identified any evidence to support this Republican claim against Secretary Clinton ,” the Democrats concluded. 
Mrs. Clinton is slated to testify in public on Thursday, and Democrats have tried to dent the committee’s credibility in the run-up to that, saying that the direction of the panel indicates it was meant to target her politically. 
House Majority Leader Kevin McCarthy appeared to lend credence to those suspicions when he said that the investigation into Mrs. Clinton ’s email practices had hurt her poll numbers. Mr. McCarthy has since said he spoke badly, and committee Chairman Trey Gowdy has said he stands by his work.
